title.narrative: Safety and security of human rights defenders

description.narrative: 1. Secure the operating environment of HRDs through progressive enactment of enabling and/or elimination of restrictive laws and policies 2. Facilitate meaningful contribution to the safety and security of HRDs by various stakeholders 3. Ensure responsive and appropriate protection mechanisms for HRDs at risk or in distress 4. Strengthen the institutional development and organisational performance of NCHRD-K
Human Rights Defenders

The funded project, Safety and Security of Human Rights Defenders, aims to promote the safety and security of human rights defenders in Kenya through advocacy, capacity building and protection. In order to effectively pursue the set out strategic objectives, NCHRD will seek to realize four (4) key outcomes: Strategic Outcome 1: Conducive environment for HRDs progressively secured at county and national levels. The long-term security and safety of HRDs is to be secured through promotion of a conducive environment at both national and sub national level in which respect for human rights is accorded to all. Strategic Outcome 2: Contribution of key stakeholders to safety and security of HRDs strengthened Safety and security of HRDs depends on the individual actions and interventions of a variety of key stakeholders including state and non-state actors and those who provide vital services to HRDs at risk - lawyers, medical personnel and counsellors. However, enhancing the respective capacities of these key stakeholders is critical in ensuring they intervene as optimally as possible. Likewise, empowering HRDs (as individuals and organizations) is also a key preventive measure. Strategic Outcome 3: Responsive and sustainable protection mechanisms for HRDs in Kenya strengthened NCHRD’s core business is about responding to HRDs facing harm. The Coalition will therefore pursue such strategies as legal aid, medical and social support, provision of refuge and relocation. Where the response required goes beyond the scope and resource capacity of the Coalition, such cases shall be referred to relevant organizations. NCHRD will also pursue options aimed at guaranteeing the sustainability of these interventions. Strategic Outcome 4: Institutional development, organizational performance and sustainability of NCHRD strengthened. NCHRD will pursue measures aimed at enhancing its ability to discharge its mandate in an effective, efficient and sustainable manner. The institutional framework of the organization shall be reviewed and improved continuously to ensure effective governance of the organization. Performance management is key to ensuring the organization delivers its obligations to various stakeholders. Sustainability measures shall be implemented to guarantee the continued existence and vibrancy of the organization.

title.narrative: Responsive and Sustainable Protection Mechanisms for Human Rights Defenders in Kenya Strengthened

description.narrative: NCHRD’s core business is about responding to HRDs facing harm. The Coalition will therefore pursue such strategies as legal aid, medical and social support, provision of refuge and relocation. The strategies to be pursued under this outcome include: • Rendering Rapid protection response to diverse HRDs at risk rendered in a timely and efficient manner: NCHRD will employ diverse protection responses and provide a communication infrastructure for receiving and processing requests for interventions • Strengthening active support networks for protection strengthened: NCHRD will mobilize and participate in joint activities with other organization that provide protection services and support to HRDs with a view to harmonizing approaches and promoting synergies • Continuously Improving standardized case management procedures and practices: this will be done to ensure protection responses are within acceptable range of best practices. NCHRD-K will maintain a case database which will be analyzed regularly to assess trends and map interventions • Enhancing sustainability of protection support to HRDs: NCHRD will put in place sustainable mechanisms to guarantee provision of responses beyond the life of this strategic plan e.g. protection fund, referrals, mentorships and advocacy for promulgation of Nairobi as a hub city (to provide safe refuge for HRDs from other countries).

title.narrative: Responsive and sustainable protection mechanisms for HRDs in Kenya strengthened

description.narrative: The strategy was implemented under the Protection Programme with the aim to develop appropriate preventative and reactive intervention strategies for the protection of HRDs. The programme analyses the HRDs’ working environment on an ongoing basis and develops security management strategies accordingly. This is done through risk assessments and fact-finding missions on reported cases of threats and violations of HRDs’ rights, to ensure the safety of HRDs and bring those responsible to justice. The protection programme provides legal, medical, psychosocial and safety support to HRDs at risk.

title.narrative: Conducive Environment for Human Rights Defenders Progressively Secured at County and National Level

description.narrative: • Progressive elimination of unlawful and undue restrictions to HRD work at county and national levels: this will entail policy, legislative and legal advocacy aimed at either repeal or invalidation of restrictive laws and administrative actions but also the enactment of enabling measures by governments at both national and county levels. NCHRD will seek to influence treaty mechanisms that have the potential for exerting pressure on the Kenyan state to realize the desirable policy or legislative actions. • Enhancing integration of human rights-based approach (HRBA) in policy development and programming at county and national levels with adequate participation of HRDs: NCHRD will empower HRDs to participate in national and county development planning processes wherein they shall advocate for adoption of HRBA. It is expected that the resultant development frameworks will embrace human rights principles and thereby create an enabling environment. The mere presence of the HRDs in these process will in itself foster better understanding among duty bearers of HRDs and their work. • Enhancing profile and public perception of HRDs at county, national and international levels: actions that seek to project HRDs and their work in positive light among key stakeholders and the public shall be pursued. This is meant to build public support and appreciation for HRDs and their work and hence enable them to operate freely. • Enhancing collaborative actions and synergies for change among HRDs at all levels: advocacy on difficult issues is more impactful and feasible if pursued collaboratively by actors that share similar ideals and aspirations. NCHRD will therefore actively mobilize for support for its advocacy agenda and reciprocally join forces with other like-minded actors seeking positive change.

title.narrative: CONDUCIVE ENVIRONMENT FOR HRDS PROGRESSIVELY SECURED AT COUNTY AND NATIONAL LEVELS

description.narrative: The advocacy program of the NCHRD-K focused on attaining a conducive working environment for HRDs, through strategic partnership and producing evidence-based reports on the situation of HRDs in Kenya. This in turn would inform protection and advocacy strategies against violations targeting HRDs in the course of their work. The information was shared with partners at national, regional and international level so as to improve the effectiveness of the protection of HRDs, hold perpetrators accountable as well as expand the scope of State responsibility for protection of HRDs.
